title_uk: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
title_us: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
description: Harry discovers he is a wizard and begins his first year at Hogwarts, uncovering the mystery of the Philosopher’s Stone.

print_run.note: The first UK hardback print run is widely reported as ~500 copies; paperbacks followed with additional runs. Exact total print-run figures were never officially consolidated.

interesting_fact: Early UK first-edition hardbacks with a young-wizard image and a misspelling of J.K. Rowling's name on the copyright page are highly collectible.

title_uk: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
title_us: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
description: In his second year, Harry confronts a dark force unleashed from the Chamber of Secrets and the legend of the Heir of Slytherin.

print_run.note: Initial print-run counts were not officially published; the book went through rapid reprints in both the UK and US.

interesting_fact: Introduces the first Horcrux revealed in the series (Tom Riddle’s diary), though its true nature is confirmed later.

title_uk: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
title_us: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
description: Harry learns the truth about Sirius Black and his parents’ past while mastering the Patronus Charm to face Dementors.

print_run.note: Exact first print figures are not publicly consolidated; demand led to multiple quick reprints.

interesting_fact: Won the 1999 Whitbread Children’s Book Award (now Costa) and the 2000 Locus Award for Best Young Adult Book.

title_uk: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
title_us: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
description: Harry is unexpectedly entered into the Triwizard Tournament, leading to Voldemort’s return and a darker turn for the series.

print_run.note: Major global release with very large first print runs across markets; precise totals vary by territory and are not centrally published.

interesting_fact: Marked a tonal shift to darker themes and significantly increased the series’ page counts.

title_uk: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
title_us: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
description: Harry forms Dumbledore’s Army as the Ministry denies Voldemort’s return, culminating in a battle at the Department of Mysteries.

print_run.note: Very large initial print runs in the UK and US; publishers announced figures by market, but a single global figure is not official.

interesting_fact: Introduces the prophecy about Harry and Voldemort; explores themes of media influence and government control.

title_uk: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
title_us: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
description: Harry delves into Voldemort’s past through Dumbledore’s lessons and confronts the mystery of the Half-Blood Prince’s textbook.

print_run.note: Record-breaking launch day sales; initial runs were extremely high, with multiple reprints following quickly.

interesting_fact: Reveals the Horcrux strategy explicitly and sets up the quest that drives the finale.

title_uk: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
title_us: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
description: Harry, Ron, and Hermione leave Hogwarts to hunt Horcruxes, uncover the legend of the Deathly Hallows, and face Voldemort in the final battle.

print_run.note: Among the largest first print runs for any book in history, especially in the US; exact combined global figure is not officially consolidated.

interesting_fact: Released simultaneously in many countries with tight embargoes to prevent leaks; midnight release parties became a global phenomenon.
